title: 112_s1592
content: The "Agricultural Credit Expansion Act" may be cited as the short title. Eligibility for farm loans is addressed in the Act. The Agricultural Credit Expansion Act, also known as the Farm Ownership Loans, amends the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act regarding eligibility requirements for farm loans. It includes provisions for limited liability companies and other legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary. The Agricultural Credit Expansion Act amends the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act to include provisions for limited liability companies and other legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary. The Agricultural Credit Expansion Act amends the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act to include provisions for limited liability companies and other legal entities as determined appropriate by the Secretary. Amendments include renumbering sections and expanding the scope of eligible legal entities. The Agricultural Credit Expansion Act amends the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act to include provisions for limited liability companies and other legal entities as determined appropriate by the Secretary. Amendments include renumbering sections and expanding the scope of eligible legal entities, with special rules regarding determinations for certain operating-only entities. The Secretary must ensure that owner-operators of family farms meet specific ownership requirements, with ownership exceeding 50 percent or as determined appropriate. Certain embedded entities owned by owner-operators are also eligible. The Secretary determines ownership requirements for owner-operators of family farms, with at least 75 percent ownership of embedded entities by individuals who own the family farm. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to include other legal entities deemed appropriate by the Secretary for Conservation Loans and to specify eligibility requirements for Farm Operating Loans. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to include additional legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary for Conservation Loans and specify eligibility requirements for Farm Operating Loans. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to include additional legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary for Conservation Loans and specify eligibility requirements for Farm Operating Loans. The amendments involve renumbering sections and removing references to limited liability companies. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to include additional legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary for Conservation Loans and specify eligibility requirements for Farm Operating Loans. Amendments involve renumbering sections and removing references to limited liability companies. Special rules are added for entities owned by other entities. The Secretary determines ownership requirements for legal entities in the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act. Emergency Loans section is amended to include special rules for entities owned by other entities. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to specify ownership requirements for legal entities. Emergency Loans section is also updated to include special rules for entities owned by other entities. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to specify ownership requirements for legal entities, including limited liability companies and other legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary. Special rules are included for entities owned by other entities in the Emergency Loans section. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to specify ownership requirements for legal entities, including limited liability companies and other legal entities. An entity that is an owner-operator or operator must meet the direct ownership requirement if owned by other entities and individuals who are owners of the family farm. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to specify ownership requirements for legal entities, including limited liability companies and other entities. Owners of family farms must have direct or indirect ownership in all related entities. Amendments are made to sections 304(c)(2) and 310D(a) of the Act. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to specify ownership requirements for legal entities, including limited liability companies and other entities. Section 310D(a) is amended to include clauses (B) through (D) of section 302(a)(1) and expand the definition of eligible legal entities to include farm cooperatives, private domestic corporations, partnerships, and other legal entities. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to include ownership requirements for legal entities such as farm cooperatives, private domestic corporations, partnerships, and other entities. Section 343(a)(11) is amended to specify additional legal entities that are eligible. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to include ownership requirements for legal entities such as farm cooperatives, private domestic corporations, partnerships, and other entities. Section 343(a)(11) is amended to specify additional legal entities that are eligible, including joint operators and owners. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to include ownership requirements for legal entities such as farm cooperatives, private domestic corporations, partnerships, and other entities. Section 343(a)(11) is amended to specify additional legal entities that are eligible, including joint operators and owners. Amendments include adding "joint operation, or such other legal entity" and "joint operators, or owners" in relevant clauses. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to include ownership requirements for legal entities such as farm cooperatives, private domestic corporations, partnerships, and other entities. Section 343(a)(11) is amended to specify additional legal entities that are eligible, including joint operators and owners. Amendments include adding "joint operation, or such other legal entity" and "joint operators, or owners" in relevant clauses. Additionally, Section 359(c)(2) is amended by updating references to specific clauses in the Act. SEC. 3 amends the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act to include refinancing loans made under the subtitle. SEC. 4 repeals certain loan term limits. SEC. 4 repeals certain loan term limits under the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act.
